catalog_info.title: Sets, Groups and Topology
catalog_info.notes: Familiarity with algebra, geometry and/or calculus is desirable. Students who have already taken Mathematics 23a,b, 25a,b or 55a,b should not take this course for credit. This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Empirical and Mathematical Reasoning. This course given fall term and repeated spring term.
catalog_info.prereq: Anti-Req: Not to be taken in addition to Mathematics 23a,b or 25a,b or 55a,b.
catalog_info.description: An introduction to rigorous mathematics, axioms, and proofs, via topics such as set theory, symmetry groups, and low-dimensional topology.
